com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Class MapScrollPaneLayout

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.ui.bean.MapScrollPaneLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
LayoutManager
public class MapScrollPaneLayout
extends Object
implements LayoutManager

A layout manager helps MapScrollPanel manage its components. By default, it places a vertical scroll bar on the right side, a horizontal scroll bar at the bottom, a empty corner component is placd on the right-bottom. Optionally button components can be added to the space the horizontal bar occupying. If there are buttons, the horizontal bar will be shortened.

Method Detail

addLayoutComponent

public void addLayoutComponent(String name,
                               Component comp)
Adds the specified component to the layout. The layout is identified using one of:
  • MapScrollPanel.MAP_COMPONENT
  • MapScrollPanel.VERTICAL_SCROLLBAR
  • MapScrollPanel.HORIZONTAL_SCROLLBAR
  • MapScrollPanel.CORNER_COMPONENT
  • MapScrollPanel.TOGGLE_BUTTON

Specified by:
addLayoutComponent in interface LayoutManager
Parameters:
name - the component identifier
comp - the the component to be added
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if s is an invalid key

Removes a compoennt.

comp - a java.awt.Component object.

public ArrayList getButtonComponents()
Returns an array of list containing the buttons components.

getCornerComponent

public Component getCornerComponent()
Obtains a right-bottom corner component object.

Returns:
a java.awt.Component object.

preferredLayoutSize

public Dimension preferredLayoutSize(Container parent)
Obtains the preferred size. It is calculated in the way, firstly obtains the parent's insets then plus Map component with and height if it is not null; finally plus the preferred size of vertical and horizontal bar.

Specified by:
preferredLayoutSize in interface LayoutManager
Parameters:
parent - a JPanel object.
Returns:
a java.awt.Dimension object.

minimumLayoutSize

public Dimension minimumLayoutSize(Container parent)
Obtains minimum size, it is calculated in the similar way as preferredLayoutSize.

Specified by:
minimumLayoutSize in interface LayoutManager
Parameters:
parent - a JPanel object.
Returns:
a java.awt.Dimension object.

layoutContainer

public void layoutContainer(Container parent)
Places the components in the given container. It will put a vertical scroll bar on the right side, a horizontal bar on the bottom and a empty component on the right-bottom corner. Optionally button components are squeezed into the horizonral bar space if there is any.

Specified by:
layoutContainer in interface LayoutManager
Parameters:
parent - a JPanel object.

addSingletonComponent

protected Component addSingletonComponent(Component oldC,
                                          Component newC)
Removes an existing component. When a new component, such as the left corner, or vertical scrollbar, is added, the old one, if it exists, must be removed.

This method returns newC. If oldC is not equal to newC and is non-null, it will be removed from its parent.

Parameters:
oldC - the Component to replace
newC - the Component to add
Returns:
the newC
